alert.note: Alert for Broadwater; Meagher (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 20 at 12:50PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Broadwater and south central Meagher Counties through 115 PM MDT... At 1245 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles east of Townsend, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... White Sulphur Springs. This storm will also affect the burn scars along Highway 12 east of Townsend. Be alert for any potential mud or debris that could flow onto the highway. This includes the following highways... Highway 12 between mile markers 10 and 42. Highway 89 between mile markers 51 and 57. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Brief heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
